Prehistory is a time period before written records. It spans from the emergence of the first humans, to the invention of writing, around 5,000 to 6,000 years ago. During this period, people developed tools, shelter, and social structures. They also domesticated animals and began to farm. As a result, prehistory is divided into several periods, each characterized by unique cultural and technological developments. These periods include the Paleolithic, Mesolithic, and Neolithic eras, with each era representing significant advances in human evolution and society. By studying prehistory, we can gain a deeper understanding of how our ancestors lived and how they adapted to their environments.
